newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia noon rubber up on Tokyo strength.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia noon rubber up on Tokyo strength.

text.p: Malaysian rubber prices were up at midday after tracking an early rise in Tokyo futures and other rubber markets in the region, traders said.
No sales or inquiries were reported, but some marginal business might be concluded before the close, said the traders.
"We haven't heard of anything traded for the day," said an official trade source. "The prices have just been adjusted to reflect the better sentiment in Tokyo, Singapore and Jakarta."
At midday, the Malaysian Rubber Exchange and Licensing Board quoted June RSS1 buyer at 271.50 cents ($1.08) a kg, up half cent from Tuesday's close.
